publisher.publisher-name: The American Association of Teachers of Spanish and Portuguese

title-group.article-title: Francisco Ayala, the Theoretical Era and Spanish-Language Literary Criticism and Theory

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 2006 American Association of Teachers of Spanish and Portuguese, Inc.

abstract.p: Francisco Ayala's creative dimension gives his literary criticism and theory an immediacy and relevancy both absent from and obscured by the academic emphases of the Theoretical Era. Since Ayala spent more than twenty years teaching in colleges and universities of the United States, including the theoretically-oriented University of Chicago, his Hispanic-tradition theory and criticism is contextualized by reference to Chicago School contemporaries and contrasted with Theoretical Era tendencies.
